title: Glee's Amber Riley 'mad' at Kevin McHale over X Factor Celebrity stint
text:
She found out on Twitter…(Pictures: REX)

X Factor Celebrity contestant Kevin McHale has admitted that while his fellow Glee pals have been supportive about his stint on the show, there’s one in particular that wasn’t pleased about how she found out.

The former actor, who wowed the judges with his version of Lizzo‘s ‘Good As Hell’ on Saturday, told Metro.co.uk that Amber Riley, who played diva Mercedes Jones in Glee, was mad at him after she found out on Twitter.

‘Amber called me the other day and said she was mad that I didn’t tell her I was doing it, instead she found out on Twitter,’ he laughed.

‘And Jenna Ushkowitz (who played Tina Cohen-Chang) and I do a podcast together so she knew I was doing it. And Matt Morrison (who played teacher Will Schuester) knew I was taking part, we still talk so we know what each other is up to.

‘They also knew how much of a fan of The X Factor I was I have loved the show for years, so they are excited for me.’

Kevin McHale with his former Glee pals (Picture: FOX via Getty Images)

Kevin, who played Artie Abrams in the teen musical, went on to explain that he gets asked about a Glee reunion all the time.

He added: ‘We are all friends so we get together all the time and I do get the reboot question a lot and who knows?

‘I can’t imagine it and I would be surprised, but if it happened it would need to be something different, where you can do it with a brand new cast.

‘And it’s based in a high school and they’re not going anywhere.’

The 31-year-old, who shot to fame in 2009 and was also in a boyband prior to Glee, has made it through to the next round of the live shows and will perform again on Saturday.

And despite nailing his audition and first performance, he denied having an advantage over the other contestants.

‘I think I am the one most known to have done music in my past but if anyone takes anything from the first episode they will know that everyone is on an even playing ground, he continued.

‘In Glee, there were 80 of us and in the Glee tour, I think I only sang two songs. It is a really different thing to be out there by myself and I understand how it comes off that I might have an advantage but just know I don’t feel that.’
